content.description: Over the rainbow is most likely the best route in rainbow. It follows very thin edges through a very intimidating face. Very fun and classic. The crux comes after the second bolt where the traverse left ends. from there you have classic moves up the face to the top.
content.protection: This is a sport route so you need six draws and some stuff for the anchor.
content.location: This route is located to the right of Aja on the blank face.

content.description: This is the hardest line in Rainbow and one of the most sustained. A lower crux after the second bolt leads to a very hard pull over the roof. If you climb this grade good luck.
content.protection: There are four bolts at the bottom which lead to a crack through a roof. Bring small pro for the top and a few draws for the bottom. There might be a bolted anchor but if not you can rappel off Jousting with a Jackal.
content.location: This starts just to the right of Lock Buster. It is the incredible small seam with bolts which lead to the small roof crack.

climbs.name: Lock Buster
climbs.fa: John Hoffman, Gene Drake, and Karl Hammer in 1979

content.description: This is the odvious corner crack on the very left side of the wall which is a fun warm up for the more harder routes.
content.protection: Pro to 2". The only fixed anchor that can be accessed for this climb is the  anchor at the top of the climb Jousting with the Jackal. If you are climbing "Lock Buster" you can get to these fixed anchors by continuing up the seam and continue up to the top of Jousting with the Jackal (12a). You can establish a trad anchor at the top of Lock Buster if you move to climber's left to a substantial ledge where it is possible to set a belay on thin gear. From there you can walk off, or if feeling insecure, can do a mini traverse pitch to flatter ground.
content.location: This is the very first route on the very left side. It is the odvious corner crack bellow and to the left of the roof.

content.description:
This route starts a few feet to the left of Lock Buster. It goes up the face and keeps going after crossing Lock Buster. Stay to the left of the roof.

This route is very stiff and has some pretty good run outs on the bottom, but the crux moves are very well protected.
content.protection: pro: Thin to medium with three bolts at the top. There is a bolted anchor with rap chains.
content.location: This starts a few feet left of the Lock Buster and goes up the face.

content.description: Gasoline Alley is another classic route. Some tricky moves at the bottom lead to some thin edges up a rounded arete. A very fun tricky route. For those who climb this grade it is a route not to miss.
content.protection: This is a mixed route so you will need small TCUS and some small nuts. There are two bolts on this route and a bolted anchor.
content.location: After hiking past Colors you will start ascending up a small hill. On your left there is a seam with a some what hard to see bolt - this is Gasoline Alley.

content.description:
Drainpipe... the name says it all.  This is a mostly hands crack with a thinner start choked with grass that opens up to big hands and wider as the angle eases.

5.8 is the grade given in Carville, however, I found the low crux (pulling on grassy hummocks with no gear in) to be rather gripping.  I had been hoping for a nice warm up for Aja, instead I found myself drenched in sweat.  Also, be aware there is no good anchor for this climb, I sat behind a small boulder, stanced it, and told Zeke he'd better not fall.

I'm giving it one star... because it might be ok if the grass were dug out of the crack.
content.protection: standard rack up to #4 camalot plus trowel and rototiller.
content.location: Right side of the left wall (same wall aja is on) left of aja, colors and over the rainbow.

content.description: Colors is another classic. With super thin edging and some really balency moves, this route will keep you entertained until the end. Colors is much harder than Over the Rainbow so be prepared.
content.protection: You will need 6 quickdraws and some stuff for the anchors. There are rap anchors at the top.
content.location: This is a few to the right of Over the Rainbow.

content.description: Aja is a pretty odvious line in the middle of the face. It is one of the best routes here and it is one of the few cracks. An OK start leads to spectacular fingers and thin hands through the right side of the roof.
content.protection: Pro: thin to 2" There might be a bolted anchor but if not you can rappel off Over the Rainbow.
content.location: This route is located in the center of the wall. It is the obvious crack on the right side of the roof.
